title: Linux aplaymidi Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the aplaymidi command, a powerful Linux utility for playing MIDI files. Learn how to use it for basic playback, as well as advanced options for controlling MIDI devices.

verify.name: Verify aplaymidi command usage
verify.hint: Make sure you can list the available MIDI devices using the `aplaymidi -l` command and that the "TiMidity port 0" device is present in the output.

verify.name: Verify MIDI file playback
verify.hint: Make sure you can play the MIDI file using the `aplaymidi -p 20:0 ~/project/example.mid` command. The Verification script checks if the command runs without any errors.

verify.name: Verify multiple device playback
verify.hint: Make sure you can play the MIDI file on both "TiMidity port 0" and "TiMidity port 1" devices using the `aplaymidi -p 20:0,20:1 ~/project/example.mid` command.
